Notes: Advanced 4.5-gen with AN/APG-82(V)1 AESA (250 km range), fly-by-wire, and 12+ AIM-120D pylons for high-volume BVR; 2025 upgrades add conformal tanks and AI targeting; core of RSAF (e.g., 13th Sqdn at Khamis Mushait), enables 140 km networked envelopes via E-3A cueing.

Tranche 3 with CAPTOR-E AESA (250 km), thrust-vectoring, and 6-8 Meteor missiles for sustained BVR; Phase 2 Enhancements (2025 IOC) boost datalink fusion; 72 operational across 4 squadrons (e.g., 1st at Dhahran), integrated with Link-16 for 130 km effective range.

Upgraded interceptor with AN/APG-63(V)3 AESA (220 km), 8 AIM-120C-7 loads, and mid-life updates for ECCM; sustains QRA volume; part of 211 total F-15 family (e.g., 2nd Sqdn at Tabuk), supports lofted launches with Saab 2000 cueing to 120 km.

Modernized F-15E derivative with AN/APG-70 radar (200 km) and 10 AIM-120D pylons for BVR strikes; 2025 SR conversions add stealth coatings; complements Typhoon in mixed ops (e.g., 55th Sqdn at Taif), enhancing SEAD-enabled salvos.

Variable-sweep wing with TERMA PESA radar (150 km) and 4-6 Meteor/AIM-120C-5 upgrades for BVR; GR4 std. mid-life extension to 2030; 81 active (e.g., 7th Sqdn at Riyadh), provides suppression support via datalinks for 110 km engagements.

AWACS with AN/APY-2 radar (400 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course AIM-120 updates; 1 RE-3A for SIGINT/ELINT jamming; 16th Sqdn at Riyadh, critical kill-chain enabler (1 more on order) for F-15/Typhoon salvos to 140 km.

Erieye AESA radar (350 km) for networked cueing and missile guidance; 2025 upgrades add IFF Mode 5; supplements E-3A for persistent coverage (e.g., 18th Sqdn), extending BVR envelopes in Gulf theater.

MRTT with boom/probe refueling for 3+ hour BVR extensions on fighters; 4 more delivered in 2025 toward 10 total; 21st Sqdn at Riyadh, enables sustained ops with US/European allies via interoperable datalinks.
